required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Exploratory Trial of a Health Education Programme Based on the Social and Emotional Competence in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study of CRECES Programme: Promoting Healthy Life Styles in Children Through the Social and Emotional Competence

lead_sponsor.agency: Clinica Universidad de Navarra, Universidad de Navarra

clinical_study.source: Clinica Universidad de Navarra, Universidad de Navarra

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to evaluate whether an intervention based on the social and emotional competence development improves the healthy lifestyles adoption in young children.

detailed_description.textblock: This study has designed, implemented and evaluated an intervention to promote healthy lifestyles in children addressing the development of the social and emotional competence. This research followed the first three stages of the Medical Research Council framework for complex interventions: the theoretical, modeling phase and the exploratory trial. A randomised control trial with 37 children (5 y 6 years old) was conducted at the exploratory trial. The first unit was implemented in 8 sessions. A multi-method and multi-informant approach was used to assess the preliminary efficacy, acceptability and feasibility of the programme.

primary_outcome.description: Directly measured on children by PERCEVAL test (Mestre, J. M., Guil, R., Martínez-Cabañas, F., Escandón, C. L., y Gonzalez de la Torre, G. (2011).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes on the total and parcial dimensions (cooperation, independence and interaction) of children's basic social skills
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-test (1 month) and 7 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Reported by parents by Preschool and Kindergarten Behavior Scales (PKBS-II; Merrell, 2003).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes on the total and parcial dimensions (comfort, satisfaction, resilience, risk avoidance and achievement) of children's health profile
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-test (1 month) and 7 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Reported by children and parents by Child Health and Illness Profile-CHILDREN Edition (CHIP-CE; Rajmil, L., Serra-Sutton, V., Alonso, J., Herdman, M., Riley, A., y Starfield, B. (2003)

other_outcome.measure: Acceptability of the programme by children and parents who took part in
other_outcome.description: Explored by semi-structured interviews with children and parents

other_outcome.measure: Efficacy on children social and emotional skills and healthy habits adoption perceived by parents
other_outcome.description: Explored by semi-structured interviews with parents

arm_group.description: Received CRECES programme during 5 weeks as part of the extracurricular plan
Continued with their habitual school routine

intervention.description: The first unit of CRECES programme was implemented in 8 sessions. Each session was 40-50 minutes long and delivered during four weeks. Parents were provided with home-extension activities.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children aged 5 and 6 enrolled in a public school in the north of Spain
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children with severe cognitive or language special needs

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Clinica Universidad de Navarra, Universidad de Navarra
